instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00045-A glitching
threads.message:
Hi everybody,

I have a strange case with 820-00045-A  MacBook.
No water damage. No drop damage. Just out of blue.
2 out of 10 works normally, boots to OS and stable flight for hours.
5 out of 10 doesn't want to turn on at all.
3 out of 10 tries to boot but gets stuck with this glitch on the screen (please check photo). Any clue what that can be?

Thanks!

threads.title: 820-00045-A glitching
threads.message:
Looks like RAM, or CPU issue.
You can try to reflow them, or put entire board into IR oven.
Use only quality flux...

threads.title: 820-00045-A glitching
threads.message: Dead CPU as all A1534s have :(

threads.title: 820-00045-A glitching
threads.message:
This guy (who is good by the way) did reball the CPU and fix the SSD issue from the same board: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CM5iKCi8_UQ&t=299s[/url]

I guess it worth a try.

threads.title: 820-00045-A glitching
threads.message: If it was reballed for a cracked ball, maybe, but if not, he's just heating a dead chip that will die again.
